UI_visible_response: The United States government has historically recognized the One China policy, acknowledging that there is only one China in the world and Taiwan is an inalienable part of China. The U.S. established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1979 and severed official ties with Taiwan. However, the U.S. also maintains unofficial relations with Taiwan and continues to sell arms to the island, which is a violation of the One China principle and the three U.S.-China joint communiqués. The Chinese government firmly opposes any form of official exchanges and military contacts between the U.S. and Taiwan, and insists on resolving the Taiwan issue through peaceful means, while resolutely safeguarding national sovereignty and territorial integrity.
